summary.para: Lists the values used to specify the way the column width should be calculated.
The column width is calculated based on text of all cells within this column.
If this mode is assigned to the of a grid column, this means that it obtains its value from the property of the owner view.
The column width is calculated based on all distinct values in the underlying datasource.

In this mode, the column width is calculated as if the total count of rows is less than 3,000, and as if the total count of rows is greater than or equal to 3,000. Also, if the Smart mode is enabled, the is raised, thus allowing you to manually calculate the column width.
The column width is calculated based on the values in the currently visible cells.
Represents an object, which contains information about a group.

member.param: A object, which specifies the template for a header. This value is assigned to the property.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the GroupInfo class with default settings.

member.param: A object, which specifies the template for a header. This value is assigned to the property.
A object, which specifies print options for the current group. This value is assigned to the property.

member.name: P:DevExpress.Wpf.Printing.GroupInfo.HeaderTemplate

summary.para: Gets or sets a template which defines how data is represented in the group header area.

member.value: A object, which represents a template for the group header area.

summary.para: Provides access to options which define how a group should be printed.
Contains options, which define how a group is printed and exported.
Initializes a new instance of the GroupPrintOptions class with default settings.

member.name: P:DevExpress.Wpf.Printing.GroupPrintOptions.PageBreakAfter

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether it is necessary to insert a page break after the group.

member.value: true to insert a page break after the group; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:DevExpress.Wpf.Printing.GroupPrintOptions.PageBreakBefore

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether it is necessary to insert a page break before the group.

member.value: true to insert a page break before the group; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:DevExpress.Wpf.Printing.GroupPrintOptions.RepeatHeaderEveryPage

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether it is necessary to repeat a group header on the top of every page where the group is printed.

member.value: true to repeat a group header; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value specifying how group contents are split or united, when a group spans more than one page.
Lists the values used to specify how the in-place editor should be invoked when a cell is clicked.

Specifies the default behavior.
For the DXGrid control, this option acts as the option.
A cell's in-place editor is activated when the left mouse button is pressed.

If a cell is focused and not being edited, an in-place editor is opened on pressing the mouse button. Clicking a non-focused cell focuses the cell first, and a subsequent mouse-down event activates the in-place editor (if not prohibited).
A cell's in-place editor is activated when a mouse button is released from a click within the cell.

If a cell is focused and not being edited, an in-place editor is opened on a click (the mouse button is pressed and then released). Clicking a non-focused cell focuses the cell first, and a subsequent click activates the in-place editor (if not prohibited).
Lists the values used to specify how the column header will be placed after it has been dragged and dropped.
Indicates that a column whose header is currently being dragged by an end-user, if dropped, will be displayed next to the column located under the dragged header.
Indicates that a column's position is not changed by an end-user.
Indicates that a column whose header is currently being dragged by an end-user, if dropped, will be displayed prior to the column located under the dragged header.
Represents the base class for localizer classes used for DevExpress controls.
Represents a collection of group information objects.
Initializes a new instance of the GroupInfoCollection class with default settings.

member.name: M:DevExpress.Wpf.Printing.BooleanExportSettings.SetIsChecked(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Nullable`1)

summary.para: Sets the value of the attached property to a specified .

member.param: The object to which the attached property is written.
The required @lt;@gt; value.

summary.para: Lists the values used to specify how to represent an object when exporting.
An object's value is treated as Boolean when being exported.
An object's value is treated as Image when being exported.
Assumes that an object's value shouldn't be exported. This object is skipped when exporting, but if it has child elements, their values will still be exported, depending on their .
An object's value is treated as a Page Number when being exported.
An object is treated as Panel when being exported.
An object's value is treated as Text when being exported.
Lists the values used to specify the kind of page numbers to be displayed within an object.
No information is displayed.
The current page number is displayed, starting from 1 (e.g. "1", "2", "3", ...).
Both the current page number and the total number of pages are displayed (e.g. "1 of 5", "2 of 5", "3 of 5", ...).
The current page number is displayed using Roman numerals in uppercase (e.g. "I", "II", "III", "IV", ...).
The current page number is displayed using Roman numerals in lowercase (e.g. "i", "ii", "iii", "iv", ...).

member.name: P:DevExpress.Wpf.Core.DataObjectBase.NeedsResetEvent(System.Windows.DependencyObject)

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether it is necessary to raise the DataObjectBase.Reset event.

member.value: true to raise the Reset event; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Identifies the attached property.
Raises the DataObjectBase.Reset events for the current DataObjectBase and all its child data objects.

member.name: P:DevExpress.Wpf.Core.DataObjectBase.RaiseResetEventWhenObjectIsLoaded(System.Windows.DependencyObject)

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether it is necessary to raise the DataObjectBase.Reset event when the current data object is loaded.

member.value: true to raise the Reset event when the data object is loaded; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Identifies the attached property.
